@emmajolly @iwikiwichick Counting the U.K. countries separately, 7, plus around the US.
@KillerMartinis New fuckery.
@cliodiaspora My remaining faint hope is that they don't take the entire world down with them.
@JillNicholls01 Yeah, I came back from 7 hours offline and discovered the US admin had threatened Mexico again & alienated Australia. 😩
@JillNicholls01 Hope your walk helped (12 hours ago)
@JillNicholls01 The international airports in Washington state are the only ones left where stuff like this isn't happening.
RT'd this thread this a.m. but here's a screenshot for the this-hr crowd. All foreigners being advised to scrub soc… https://t.co/xqccFg9PLW
Good day researching @ the regional archive branch despite being inaccurately told@ National Archives that I could access vital records here
New Zealand TV, I can't tell you how seriously I can't handle your show about abandoned dogs this week
The staff is being incredibly helpful here in Dunedin. #genealogy #twitterstorians #archives https://t.co/MjeZsjAjuN
I see the world has not magically improved while I was offline. 😔
Hi from a cafe where I am taking a break for lunch and to use their free wifi to look up a couple things for research (archive wifi is down)
Off to the regional branch of the National Archives. Nearly at the point where I consider crossing my fingers every time I go offline
@JillNicholls01 Yes, I saw 😖 Good luck clearing your head. I'm pulling myself away to go do research. (Here's hoping it helps)
@JillNicholls01 13 hours difference, it's only 9:13 a.m.!
@JillNicholls01 Been trying to pull myself away to go to the archive. Opened a few minutes ago and I've got a decent walk to get there
@megansmolenyak Indeed, very hard to keep up on here - fast enough to repeat it in a new tweet!
@megansmolenyak Guessing you missed my RT about how someone needs to buy a ceremonial kettle for his office 😉
Frederick Douglass in 1889 on a question still being asked in the U.S. today https://t.co/c4GlfWcrAo

@RobTaber Thanks.
@RobTaber What's this legislation? And in which part of Congress?
@jendeaderick Indeed, which to me makes his remark even more striking! (Oops, that wasn't an intentional pun :D )
@jendeaderick 2/2 to die for it while Douglass was only willing to live for it.
@jendeaderick Douglass said late in his life that Brown had probably been more dedicated to Douglass's race because Brown was willing 1/2
@Boston1775 I haven't read anything that was clear as to which it was.
@whitmanesque As I said to someone yesterday: I no longer worry about being called an alarmist
@Boston1775 I read a tweet overnight your time that he'd been on his way to D.C. & gotten a call to turn around. Don't think it cited source

That leaves Seattle & Vancouver WA as only airports on US soil where people can land without risk of meeting noncompliant officials.
It seems reason Logan Airport (Boston) no longer compliant with court orders is Logan's USCIS head resigned or was fired.
I had dinner tonight in what was once part of the largest tea rooms in the Southern Hemisphere. #nz #ttot https://t.co/adUYV6AQ7P

Every time the New Zealand news talks about the US administration they include footage of protests. Even the Supreme Court story tonight.
@Boston1775 Including an 11-month-old! (That still gets me the most)
@altUSEPA Not old at all! And almost everyone said it was deleted - people didn't take the time to fact-check the original claim 😶
@altUSEPA His tweet is still up (despite widespread reports that it was deleted after the ban was enacted).

Good morning from New Zealand. It's 5:20 and I haven't had coffee yet. 😴☕️

2/2 "undesirable" immigrants whom he believed were unfairly taking monetary support away from Americans. New census change seems a return.
Massachusetts' own Lemuel Shattuck was behind the every-name census US researchers now take for granted.His aim was tracking & deterring 1/2

Watching the New Zealand news. Like BBC, their footage includes an aerial shot of the Boston protest with @BPLBoston in the background.

Finally boarding. See y'all on the other side
I showed aerial shots of today's Boston protest to the staff at the cafe where I was killing time. They were happy to see such a big crowd.
Hi from Wellington Airport. Heading to the South Island.
The businesspeople at the next table are talking about 2017: What is Trump going to do "and will the Eurozone survive."
@cliodiaspora I wonder whether she doesn't realize officials on the ground are ignoring instructions or doesn't care.

Excited to be able to store some of my luggage here long-term while I travel onward.
